title: Taylor Swiftâ€™s Re-Releases: How â€˜Taylorâ€™s Versionâ€™ Boosts Album Popularity
text:
Understanding Metacritic and User Scores

Metacritic Score
The Metacritic Score is a weighted average of reviews from top-tier critics and publications. It provides a comprehensive view of an albumâ€™s critical reception. Scores range from 0 to 100, with higher scores indicating more favorable reviews. For instance, a Metacritic Score of 90 suggests universal acclaim, while a score below 60 may indicate mixed or unfavorable reviews.


User Score
The User Score is an average rating submitted by users on Metacritic. Unlike the Metacritic Score, which aggregates professional criticsâ€™ reviews, the User Score reflects the general audienceâ€™s perception. Scores range from 0 to 10, with higher scores signifying greater user satisfaction. This metric helps gauge how well an album resonates with the broader fanbase.
The absolute value of these for both the original and the re-released albums can be seen in TableÂ 1.

As taylor wisely puts it in her song Youâ€™re on your own kid, â€œEverything you lose is a step you take.â€ this sentiment perfectly captures her journey to reclaim her music and evolve as an artist.
